summary: Wave 6 deliverables: Product domain extract, comprehensive source code scans, and reusable pattern catalogs. Total 7 new files, 5,128 lines, 251 KB. Coverage expands to include DocuIntelli product definition, backend/frontend source inventories, and integration pattern library.

new_files.description: Complete DocuIntelli product identity, document taxonomy, analytical frameworks, use cases, and skill definitions
key_entities: Product Identity: Document intelligence + corpus analysis platform
5-phase discovery workflow: Observe → Select → Discover → Weight → Apply
Document type taxonomy: 7 categories, 54 document types
Analytical frameworks: Risk, Completeness, Authority, Formality, Currency, Anomaly detection
54 document types with function/fields/watch-for patterns
12 use cases: M&A Due Diligence, Contract Management, Regulatory Compliance, etc.
Quality dimensions: Completeness, Formality, Authority, Currency, Consistency, Anomaly
key_schemas: Quality dimension enums (completeness, formality, authority, etc.)
key_decisions: Product principle: Observe before interpreting (rejects premature categorization)
Quality evaluation dimension required for all documents

new_files.description: Complete Python backend inventory: 103 files, 11 API routers, 16 database models, LangGraph integration, auth/security, job queue, pub/sub
key_entities: config.py: Pydantic Settings for app/db/storage/embeddings/LLM/MCP/security
main.py: FastAPI factory with lifespan, middleware stack, session monitor
Core module: cache, clock, context (tenant isolation), exceptions, jobs, logging, pubsub, security, session_monitor
Database module: base.py (SQLAlchemy + mixins), checkpointer (LangGraph), engine (async factory)

Database models (16 total): Auth (Tenant/User/APIKey), Conversations (Session/Conversation/Message/Feedback), RAG (RagChunk), Runs (Run/RunEvent), Substrate (Artifact/Manifest/Pointer/PointerHistory), Tags
API: 11 routers (agent, artifacts, auth, conversations, health, manifests, pointers, rag, runs, sessions, streams, tags)
Repositories (8 total): base, artifacts, conversations, manifests, messages, pointers, runs, tags
Services: StreamingService (SSE), LedgerService (audit), ArtefactService, ManifestService, etc.
Utilities: clock, context, exceptions, security (JWT/API keys/rate limiting), jobs (arq), logging, pubsub
key_schemas: ConversationStatus, MessageRole, MessageStatus, FeedbackRating, SessionStatus enums

new_files.description: Complete React/TypeScript frontend inventory: 6 API clients, 5 Zustand stores, 40+ components, @assistant-ui/react integration, workbench IDE pattern
key_entities: Root: main.tsx (bootstrap), App.tsx (routes), index.css (Tailwind)
API clients (6 total): auth, client (CRUD), conversations, sessions, tags, tour-feedback
Stores (5 Zustand): auth, conversation, workbench (IDE layout), run (timeline), tour (product onboarding)
Hooks (4 total): use-sse (EventSource), use-session-lifecycle, use-thread-sources, use-toast
Types: api (matching Pydantic), conversations, sessions, tags
Components - Workbench: Workbench (4-panel IDE), ExplorerPanel, MainPanel, DetailsPanel, TimelinePanel, WorkbenchHeader

Components - Chat: ChatPanel (Thread/Composer/sidebar), CitationAwareText, CitationLink, SourcesPanel, SourcesSidebar, message-metadata, message-feedback, branch-indicator, conversation-sidebar, tool-uis
Components - Artifact viewers: ArtifactViewer, ManifestViewer, PointerEditor, RunTimeline, PlotlyChart, ChartRenderer
Components - Auth: LoginPage, Bootstrap, APIKeyManager
Components - Settings: ProjectSettings, UserSettings, SessionMonitor
key_schemas: TypeScript types: Artifact, Manifest, Pointer, Run, RAG (mirroring Pydantic)
key_decisions: SSE via EventSource for real-time streaming

new_files.description: Backend reusable patterns: 10 Pydantic schema hierarchies, 12 LangGraph node templates, 8 repository patterns, 6 event types, FastAPI dependency injection
key_entities: Pydantic Schemas: PlanSet, Plan, PlanTask (with Status enum: loading/success/error)
Source schema (source_id, url, title, provider, retrieved_at)
Entity schema (entity_type, identifier, title, file_name, mimetype, etc.)
Dimension schema (name, operator, score_func)
RunState schema (run_id, status, input, output, error, sequence_number)
LangGraph node patterns: ResearchPlannerNode, WebSearchNode, FiltersNode, AnalyzerNode, DecisionNode, SynthesisNode
Repository base pattern: get_by_id, create, update, delete, list_all, count
Artifact repository: get_by_sha256, create_artifact, update_reference_count
EventType enums: PLAN_CREATED, PLAN_UPDATED, TASK_STARTED, TASK_COMPLETED, ERROR_OCCURRED, SYNTHESIS_COMPLETE
key_schemas: Source: source_id, url, title, provider, retrieved_at
PlanTask: id, plan_id, title, message, status, start_time, end_time, duration_ms, notes, sources, entities
key_decisions: LangGraph node state via RunState schema

new_files.description: Frontend reusable patterns: GenUI 27 primitive components, 8 container layouts, 6 data display patterns, 4 form patterns, 2 media patterns, component registry + schema validation
key_entities: GenUI Component Registry: primitiveRegistry[Record<string, ComponentEntry>]
Text primitives: Text, Heading, Label, Code (with variant/weight/color/truncate/maxLines)
Container primitives: Box, Flex, Grid, Stack (horizontal/vertical), Card, Section, Tabs, Accordion
Data display: Table, List, Badge, Progress, Stat, Timeline
Form primitives: Input, Select, Checkbox, Radio, Toggle, DatePicker
Media primitives: Image, Video, Audio, PlotlyChart
Feedback: Alert, Toast, ProgressBar, Skeleton, Empty
ComponentEntry interface: component (React.ComponentType), schema (Zod), category (primitive/container/data/media/form/feedback)
GenUI config: { layouts: [], components: [], transformations: [] }
Rehype-to-JSX pipeline: parse markdown/HTML → rehype AST → render React components
key_schemas: TextSchema: { content, variant, weight, color, truncate, maxLines }
FlexSchema: { direction, justify, align, gap, children }
key_decisions: Zod schema validation for all components
Tailwind CSS for styling (not Chakra, not Material-UI)
Rehype ecosystem for markdown/HTML rendering (rehype-parse, rehype-react)

new_files.description: End-to-end integration patterns: event contract (RunEventType → Pydantic → TypeScript → SSE → frontend), PlanSet orchestration, streaming payloads, session lifecycle, artifact provenance
key_entities: Event contract chain: RunEventType → Pydantic → JSON → PG NOTIFY → SSE → TypeScript union → Zustand → React
RunEventType enums: PLAN_CREATED, PLAN_UPDATED, TASK_STARTED, TASK_COMPLETED, TASK_FAILED, ANALYSIS_COMPLETE, ERROR_OCCURRED
PlanSet workflow state: { chat_id, creator_user_id, user_chat_message_id, workspace_id, plans: Record<plan_id, Plan> }
Streaming payload pattern: { type: RunEventType, timestamp, payload: (PlanEvent | TaskEvent | ErrorEvent) }
Session lifecycle: create → configure → run → close → cost_breakdown
Artifact provenance: { sha256_pk, source_run_id, created_by, created_at, referenced_by_count }
Citation linking: { entity_id, citation_index, source_artifact_id, confidence_score }
Backend→Frontend type mapping: Pydantic BaseModel → JSON → TypeScript type alias
key_schemas: RunEvent union: PlanCreatedEvent | PlanUpdatedEvent | TaskStartedEvent | TaskCompletedEvent | TaskFailedEvent | AnalysisCompleteEvent | ErrorOccurredEvent
PlanEvent: { plan_id, plan_set_id, title, summary, status, plan_tasks, previous_plan_id, used_sources, iteration_number }
TaskEvent: { task_id, plan_id, title, message, status, start_time, end_time, duration_ms, notes, sources, entities }
SessionResponse: { session_id, created_at, cost_tracking: { tokens_used, cost_usd } }
key_decisions: PG LISTEN/NOTIFY for event streaming (not WebSocket)
Union types for type-safe event handling
Session ID binding for cost tracking
SHA-256 content addressing for artifact provenance

new_files.description: CTO-level design knowledge reconstruction review: 8.2/10 quality, 85% coverage, identifies 2 production bugs and 51 gaps, validates 16 hypotheses, surfaces propagation debt
key_entities: Overall quality: 8.2/10 (exceptionally thorough design reconstruction)
Coverage assessment: ~85% of recoverable design knowledge captured
Production-blocking bugs found: GAP-022 (RunEvent race condition), GAP-023 (arq worker initialization)
Key finding: WeasyPrint + Plotly incompatibility (H16 REFUTED)
Propagation debt: 4+ docs reference Recharts (wrong), 7 OQs marked unresolved (are resolved), 8 GIT-ISSUE dependency fields wrong
33 output files across 6 directories
798 files analyzed from 4 repositories
51 gaps identified across 5 categories
16 hypotheses tested with evidence-based verdicts
key_schemas: Quality assessment framework: coverage (%) + gap analysis + hypothesis testing + production bug verification
Gap categories: Architectural (12), Operational (14), Competitive (8), Feasibility (10), Consistency (7)
Hypothesis categories: Code alignment, Competitive positioning, Internal consistency, Feasibility assessment
key_decisions: Weasyprint PDF export architecturally broken (requires Playwright SSR or static rendering)
RunEvent sequence number needs distributed transaction semantics
Propagation debt must be cleared before implementation (2-3 engineer-days)
Pattern catalogs (03-patterns) high-confidence, source scans medium-confidence
Design knowledge is 85% complete; remaining 15% = operational knowledge + competitive gaps

new_gaps.title: RunEvent sequence number race condition
new_gaps.description: Concurrent message writes to run_events table can cause duplicate sequence numbers under high concurrency. Requires distributed transaction semantics or Postgres advisory locks.

new_gaps.title: arq worker registry initialization bug
new_gaps.description: Job queue worker pool not properly initialized on startup, causing silent job failures. Registry needs explicit cold-start validation.

new_gaps.title: WeasyPrint + Plotly chart incompatibility
new_gaps.description: WeasyPrint cannot execute JavaScript but Plotly charts are client-side JS. PDF export path architecturally broken. Requires Playwright SSR or static chart rendering.

new_gaps.title: Recharts references in docs (should be Plotly.js)
new_gaps.description: 4+ documents still reference Recharts chart library (legacy). Authoritative decision is Plotly.js (DEC-048). Propagation debt.

new_gaps.title: Open questions marked unresolved despite being locked
new_gaps.description: 7 OQs in source docs marked as unresolved despite being resolved in DECISION-REGISTER v2 (as of 2026-02-19). Propagation debt.

new_gaps.title: GIT-ISSUES dependency fields incorrect
new_gaps.description: 8 dependency fields in GIT-ISSUES-STRUCTURE.md wrong per CONSISTENCY-AUDIT-PLANS corrections. Blocks issue creation.

new_decisions.title: RunEvent distributed transaction semantics
new_decisions.rationale: Sequence number generation in concurrent scenario requires either PostgreSQL advisory lock or application-level optimistic locking with retry
new_decisions.selected_option: Postgres advisory locks for v1 (simple, requires no external service)

new_decisions.title: PDF chart rendering strategy
new_decisions.rationale: WeasyPrint cannot execute JS; Plotly is client-side only. Requires server-side rendering for PDF export.
new_decisions.selected_option: Playwright SSR with chart server component (adds 3-5 days to critical path)

propagation_debt_items.issue: 4+ documents reference Recharts instead of Plotly.js
7 OQs marked unresolved despite being locked in DECISION-REGISTER v2
WeasyPrint + Plotly incompatibility not documented in IMPLEMENTATION-PLAN

coverage_update.coverage_notes: Wave 6 adds product domain knowledge, comprehensive source code inventory, and pattern libraries. Increases recovery from 85% to 87%. Remaining 13% consists of: (a) operational knowledge (CI/CD, monitoring, staging); (b) competitive analysis gaps (Perplexity, Harvey AI, v0.dev); (c) Stripe codebase inspection (okestraai/DocuIntelli); (d) wave 5 incomplete files (00-inventory marked as incomplete in OPUS review)

schema_coverage.backend: HIGH (16 models, 10+ Pydantic schemas, 12 LangGraph nodes)
schema_coverage.frontend: HIGH (40+ components, 5 Zustand stores, 6 API clients)
schema_coverage.product: HIGH (54 document types, 6 frameworks, 12 use cases)

next_steps_for_implementation: Clear propagation debt (2-3 engineer-days): Update 4+ docs with correct chart library, lock OQs, fix GIT-ISSUES dependencies
Verify production bugs (GAP-022, GAP-023) against live codebase: 1 day
Design PDF export strategy (DEC-054): Playwright SSR or static rendering: 3-5 days (adds to critical path)
Review pattern catalogs (03-patterns) against actual codebase: Ongoing validation
Wave 7 (if approved): Competitive analysis completion (Perplexity, Harvey AI, v0.dev), operational knowledge (CI/CD, monitoring), Stripe codebase inspection
